required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomised, Single Centre, Double-blind, Two-period, Cross-over Trial in Healthy Subjects Investigating the Bioequivalence Between Subcutaneous Injections of Semaglutide Produced by Two Manufacturing Processes
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Single Centre, Double-blind, Two-period, Cross-over Trial in Healthy Subjects Investigating the Bioequivalence Between Subcutaneous Injections of Semaglutide Produced by Two Manufacturing Processes

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe. The aim of the trial is to investigate the bioequivalence (assessment of the expected biological equivalence of two pharmaceutical drug products with identical active ingredient) between subcutaneous injections of semaglutide produced by two manufacturing processes.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma semaglutide concentration curve
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-4 weeks after a single dose s.c. semaglutide administration

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax, the maximum plasma semaglutide concentration
primary_outcome.time_frame: 20-40 hours after a single dose s.c. semaglutide administration

secondary_outcome.measure: The area under the plasma semaglutide concentration curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to infinity after a single dose s.c. semaglutide administration

secondary_outcome.measure: tmax, time to Cmax of semaglutide
tÂ½, terminal elimination half-life of semaglutide

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to follow-up (5-7 weeks after the second dosing)
From first dosing to follow-up (5-7 weeks after the second dosing)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Formulation A followed by Formulation B
Formulation B followed by Formulation A

intervention.description: For subcutaneous (s.c., under the skin), single dose administration at two separate dosing visits.
intervention.arm_group_label: Formulation A followed by Formulation B
Formulation B followed by Formulation A

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects
- Body mass index (BMI) of 18.5-30 kg/m^2 (both incl.)
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of or presence of cancer, diabetes, pancreatitis or any clinically relevant cardiovascular diseases or other major disorders
- Use of prescription or non-prescription medicinal products (except routine vitamins, acetylsalicylic acid and paracetamol) within 3 weeks (or within 5 half-lives of the medicinal product, whichever is longest) prior to the first dosing of semaglutide
- Smoking, drug or alcohol abuse
- Female of childbearing potential who is pregnant, breast-feeding or intend to become pregnant or not using adequate contraceptive methods for the duration of the trial and for 3 months following the last dose of semaglutide
